page.title: 19Liverpool Dialects
page.content: The language used by Liverpudlians contains many interesting expressions. Here are some examples of common Liverpool terms: 1.Woollyback _ a person not from Liverpool. 2.Skitting _ making fun of somebody. 3.Made up _ feeling very happy. 4.Queen _ girl or woman. 5.Divvy _ somebody silly. 6.Get your head down _ go to sleep. 7.Moggy _ a cat. 8.Sagging or bunking off _ playing truant. 9.Ollies _ marbles. 10.Jigger _ alley. 11.A scally _ a troublemaker. 12.Knackered _ feeling very tired. 13.A bevvy _ a drink. 14.A bizzy _ a policeman. 15.Scouse _ meat and potato stew.
